item.title: My Name is Nobody
item.description: My Name Is Nobody is a 1973 western comedy film starring Terence Hill and Henry Fonda. The film was directed by Tonino Valerii.

item.title: Buffalo Bill, Hero of the Far West
item.description: Buffalo Bill, Hero of the Far West is a 1964 Italian spaghetti western directed by Mario Costa.

item.title: The Dirty Outlaws
item.description: The Dirty Outlaws, also known as Big Ripoff, King of the West and The Desperado, is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western starring Andrea Giordana.

item.title: Dead Men Don't Count
item.description: Dead Men Don't Count is a 1968 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.

item.title: Fury of Johnny Kid
item.description: Fury of Johnny Kid is a 1967 Italian-Spanish film directed by Gianni Puccini. The Italian and Spanish versions of the film have different ending. The film is a spaghetti western version of William Shakespeare's tragedy Romeo and Juliet.

item.title: Bullet in the Flesh
item.description: Bullet in the Flesh or Il piombo e la carne is a 1964 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Marino Girolami.

item.title: My Name Is Shanghai Joe
item.description: The Fighting Fist of Shanghai Joe is a 1973 Spaghetti Western kung fu film. The film was released in a number of alternate titles in the United States, including To Kill or to Die and The Dragon Strikes Back. The film was directed by Mario Caiano and stars Chen Lee as Shanghai Joe.

item.title: The Forgotten Pistolero
item.description: The Forgotten Pistolero is a 1969 Italian Spaghetti Western film co-written and directed by Ferdinando Baldi. The film is a western adaptation of the Greek myth of Orestes, subject of three famous drama-plays by Aeschylus, Sophocles and Euripides. Ulrich P. Bruckner puts it among the "most interesting and most touching Spaghetti Westerns of the late sixties".

item.title: Per il gusto di uccidere
item.description: Per il gusto di uccidere is the 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film debut directed by Tonino Valerii. It is also the first film to use the camera system known as 2P. It was filmed in Almería. It is produced by Francesco Genesi, Vincenzo Genesi, Daniele Senatore, Stefano Melpignano and Jose Lopez Moreno, scored by Nico Massi and edited by Rosa G. Salgado.

item.title: I Am Sartana, Trade Your Guns for a Coffin
item.description: Sartana's Here… Trade Your Pistol for a Coffin is a 1970 spaghetti western that is the third of the Sartana film series with George Hilton taking over the lead role from Gianni Garko. The film was shot in Italy and directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.
